definition:
A &%FlatWhite is a variation of &%Milkfoam 
and &%Espresso &%Mixture. It is typically made with 1 shot of 
&%Espresso with 5 part of foamed milk, so a standard 30ml of espresso with 150ml of milk, 
giving a 180ml of capuucino.The thickness of milk foam on the top varies between 1 to 20 mm.
The main difference betwen a flat white and a cappuccino is that the milkfoam in a flat white
is wet foam and that the milkfoam is mixed with the crema of the espresso. [Wikipedia]
